snippet: The chief public prosecutor appointed last month by President Mohamed Morsi stepped down Monday after a demonstration by district prosecutors accusing him of political bias.
abstract: Talaat Ibrahim Abdullah, Egypt's chief public prosecutor who was appointed one month earlier by Pres Mohamed Morsi, steps down after demonstration by district prosecutors accusing him of political bias.
lead_paragraph: The chief public prosecutor appointed last month by President Mohamed Morsi stepped down Monday after a demonstration by district prosecutors accusing him of political bias.

headline.seo: Chief Public Prosecutor in Egypt Quits After One Month
headline.main: Egypt: Chief Public Prosecutor Quits After One Month
headline.print_headline: Egypt: Chief Public Prosecutor Quits After One Month
